metadata.title: CVE-2016-6232 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in KArchive before 5.24, as used in KDEFrameworks, allows remote attackers to write to arbitrary files via a ../(dot dot slash) in a filename in an archive file, related to KNewsstuffdownloads.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6232` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kdelibs-bin - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.3
kdelibs5-data - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.3
kdelibs5-plugins - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.3
kdoctools - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.3
libkcmutils4 - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.3

criterions.comment: kde4libs package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.3').
